doc.title: Company Surveys Tick Up, Remain Resilient.
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Company Surveys Tick Up Remain Resilient.Company Surveys Tick Up Remain Resilient._2025-08-29

passages.text: - Our Company Surveys rose from 49.5 to 49.6 and remain resilient. Breadth has broken out to \(+6.6\%\) led by consumer cos...

- Our Retailers Survey ticked up and has been over 50 for ten weeks as promotions, back-to-school, and some prebuy appears to have helped sales. Pricing power has remained solid. Other consumer surveys have also increased over the past two months, generally to a lesser degree, but show resilient results.
- Employment Cos. report moderation in August, but our survey of staffing firms remains above 50 and wage pressures are stable.
- Industrial data is mixed with improvement at Cap Goods & Tech Cos. while Chemical and Mfg. Cos. are softer. Global growth remains soft with relative strength in the U.S.
- Pricing power across our Company Surveys has stabilized with relative strength at retailers, while consumer staples and mfg. cos. have been softer.
Breadth was soft in 3Q24, but improved after the U.S. election before turning negative mid- January. Since then, breadth moved sideways, before breaking out in early July.
Evercore ISI Company Surveys Diffusion Index 8 Wk. Avg. Aug 29 +6.6%

Our Retailers Sales Survey moved up from 56.6 to 57.4 on continued solid back- to- school sales. Discretionary sales are outperforming as back- to- school season lifts results. This is the tenth week in a row over 50 on the Retailers Survey as activity has been good. Consumers remain value focused and are shopping around holidays, promotions, and other events creating dispersion and choppiness to the data in recent months.
Evercore ISI Restaurants Sales Surveys 0=Weak 100=Strong 4 Wk. Avg. Aug 29 46.1
Our Restaurants Survey continues to grind higher, lifted by the qsr segment which has focused on value in recent months which has helped results.

Our weekly Employment Cos. Survey was unchanged at 50.1, and was generally slower in August as the trend is sideways, though the level suggests okay activity. Companies expressed caution on hiring plans in the midyear update we published in June.
Evercore ISI Employment Cos. Sales Survey: Revenues 0=Weak 100=Strong 4 Wk. Avg. Aug 29 50.3
Wage pressures have stabilized around the middle of the historic range.
Evercore ISI Employment Cos. Survey: Wage Pressure

Our CSDI: Industrials remains soft on an 8 wk.avg. basis, though we see improvement recently from our Cap Good Cos. & Tech Cos. Surveys. Weakness is coming from chemicals and mfg. cos. while E&C cos. were flat.
Evercore ISI Company Survey Diffusion Index: Industrials 8 Wk. Avg. Aug 29 -1.9%
Evercore ISI Company Surveys: Global Avg. Company Survey Average, China Sales Survey & Europe Sales Survey Aug 29 38.8
Our global Company Survey Average remains soft with relative strength in U.S. activity.

Our weekly aggregate pricing power metric has moved up modestly as the retailer portion of the index has risen. In contrast, the latest moves from consumer staples and mfg. cos. have been lower. The softness suggests trade down and some push back on price increases, though anecdotes suggest more price increases are coming.
Company Survey Diffusion 8 Wk.Avg.

figures.title: Company Survey Average, China Sales Survey & Europe Sales Survey
Our Company Surveys remain above recession level which we place at 45.
